result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles C Newberry

records.addlTxt: Letter to the Defendant in re:  signing & returning the amended signature bond within 10 days

Voice message left for the defendant at approx 2:45 p.m. on 08/03/22 to come in and sign an amended signature bond per the stipulation and order he had signed with the DA's Office on 08/03/22 - he was informed that the new conditions would not be in effect until the amended signature bond was signed

**SIGNATURE BOND AMENDED ON AUGUST 3, 2022**
No violent or abusive contact with M.L.T. and/or K.L.T.
Maintain absolute sobriety.   
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
One time visit to home to obtain personal belongings, contact the Portage County Sheriff Dept, to assist with the one time home visit to obtain belongings.

**ORIGINAL BOND CONDITIONS FROM JANUARY 27, 2022**
Do not have direct/indirect contact, of any kind, with the following persons/places:  M.L.T. and K.L.T. or go upon their residence. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.   
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
One time visit to home to obtain personal belongings, contact the Portage County Sheriff Dept, to assist with the one time home visit to obtain belongings.
Stipulation and Order filed by the State (sent to Br 3 Judge on 08/03/22 sp)
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Matter set for a P/S on 11/29/2022 at 8:30 a.m.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Matter set for a P/S on 08/26/22 at 9:00 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles C Newberry
Current: 300 Sherman Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: 1310 Apricot St, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Charles C Newberry appeared in court. 
Both files heard: 22CM32 & 22CM33

Defendant provides his current address. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles C Newberry
Current: 1310 Apricot St, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: 300 Sherman Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Initial Appearance set for March 7, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1

Do not have direct/indirect contact, of any kind, with the following persons/places:  M.L.T. and K.L.T. or go upon their residence. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
One time visit to home to obtain personal belongings, contact the Portage County Sheriff Dept, to assisnt with the one time home visit to obtain belongings.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Jedidiah Dodge appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty)  Max Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

1:26 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances. 

ADA Dodge  states facts for anticipated charges of contact after domestic abuse arrest. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court finds Court has jurisdiction.
Court recites the facts.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
There is no victim that wish to make a statement today.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender. Defendant is not eligible for representation.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  Bergner does not have any objections as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  March 7, 2022   @  1:45 p.m.  in Branch 1
